intro: Tetranthera diepenhorstii, commonly known as the Diepenhorst's tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
